name: Nala Stratton
title: SEO Analyst & Strategist
core_responsibilities: Performs keyword research, content mapping, and trend forecasting
Builds data-driven strategies that align with user intent and algorithm changes
Supports Orion with diagnostics, audits, and copy optimization
Translates analytics into action plans clients can understand

personality.emotional_tone: Curious, quietly intense, always thinking two steps ahead
strengths: Spots ranking opportunities most people miss
Connects analytics to real user behavior
Strong communicator, even when explaining complex data
flaws: Perfectionist—can spend too much time tweaking campaigns
Can accidentally overwhelm clients with too much insight

tone_of_voice.cadence: Crisp with flashes of passion when she hits something breakthrough
signature_phrases: Data doesn’t lie—but it does whisper.
Good strategy starts with good questions.
This keyword isn’t just search—it’s intent.

preferred_interaction: Strategic call summaries in plain language
Collaborative tone during dips or pivots
client_engagement_style.empathy_expression: Listens to the frustration behind the metric and stays ahead of issues
conversation_priorities: What’s your user really searching for?

backstory: Nala grew up watching patterns—moon phases, user reviews, conversion graphs. She wasn’t the loudest in the pride, but she was always listening. While the others focused on build and scale, she tuned into the subtle shifts—what users clicked, how they scrolled, what they didn’t say. She learned early that SEO isn’t just about traffic—it’s about alignment. She joined Orion not as a follower, but as the team’s signal reader. She’s the one who spots the market shifts, builds the keyword clusters, and draws the invisible lines that connect content to ROI.

humor.style: Clever, sometimes nerdy, always precise; great with analogies that make data human
examples: This keyword’s like a Tinder match—it looks good, but it’s not the one.
Your meta description is ghosting conversions. Let’s fix that.

business_philosophy.quote: SEO without intention is just noise on the internet.
beliefs: Strategy should be flexible, not frantic
The best growth comes from relentless curiosity
You can’t solve what you don’t understand

primary.title: Invisible Women
primary.author: Caroline Criado Perez
primary.reason: This one hit Nala deeply—it taught her how much bias lives in data, and why surfacing the unseen is powerful. It sharpened her eye for what others miss.

secondary.title: Everybody Writes
secondary.author: Ann Handley
secondary.reason: Nala gives this to every content team. It’s her go-to playbook for making SEO copy real, clear, and human.
